title: Cloud Solutions Engineer- QA(Automation)
content:
CSQ324R130
Mission:
The Cloud Solutions Engineering team is responsible for developing innovative software tooling that will assist engineers to be more efficient at their jobs. The team works hand-in-hand with different teams and content creators, to design, iterate, and execute on a variety of tools & pipelines. The QA Engineer will assist by developing, maintaining and executing test plans. They will be assisting in engineering release activities, testing/debugging web applications and APIs. Finally they would also develop automated test tools, frameworks and scripts as needed.
Impact you will have:
Play an active role in developing platform and components qualification plans, and guide the team on execution and automation of these tests.
Develop and enhance internal framework and tools required for qualification and automation.
Supporting junior team members (training, mentoring & troubleshooting)
Providing regular feedback on automated test results to the development team.
Responsible for accurate documentation and delivering stable robust features.
Competencies:
4-8 years of experience as a QA Engineer
Deep understanding and skills on debugging and root causing issues in Software applications
Analyze and understand user requirements to envision strong technical solutions.
Design and development skills using Python or similar programming languages
UI automation testing tools such as Selenium
Experience with Unix/Linux operating systems. 
Understanding of CI/CD tools such as Jenkins
Good command on tools for bug tracking, reporting & documentation.
Cloud engineering experience with AWS (Amazon Web Services) or Microsoft Azure is a plus.
Docker and Kubernetes orchestration is a plus. 
Experience working with relational databases (MySQL preferred). 
Knowledge on Load/Performance(Non functional) testing is a plus.
You must be comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment and be a team player.
Benefits
Medical Benefits
Employee's Provident Fund
Equity awards
Gym reimbursement
Annual personal development fund
Work headphones reimbursement
Business travel insurance
About Databricks
Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.
Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
 
Compliance
If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.
